intro: Mammillaria villifera var. carnea, commonly known as the pink mammillaria, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its short, cylindrical stems covered in white, woolly spines. The plant produces small, pink flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for arid environments. Due to its compact size and ornamental value, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and indoor cultivation.
